newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sets 120 bln bolivar TEM bill auction.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sets 120 bln bolivar TEM bill auction.

text.p: The Central Bank of Venezuela announced for Wednesday morning a 120 billion bolivar auction of 177-, 268- and 358-day "monetary stabilization," or TEM, bills at nominal interest rates of up to 21.47 percent.

The bank said it would offer 70 billion bolivars worth of 177-day bills with a nominal interest rate of 20.42 percent, 25 billion bolivars of 268-day bills at 20.94 percent and 25 billion bolivars of 358-day bills at 21.47 percent.
At its auction last week, the central bank sold 200 billion bolivars worth of 177-, 266- and 358-day bills with yields of 20.42, 22.77 and 23.72 percent respectively.
